//healthProblem 1: Diabetes Mellitus Diabetes Mellitus A chronic condition that affects how the body processes blood sugar (glucose). 1. Increased thirst and frequent urination
2. Extreme hunger
3. Unexplained weight loss
4. Fatigue
5. Blurred vision
6. Slow healing of wounds 1. Medications: Type 1: Insulin injections; Type 2: Metformin or Sulfonylureas
2. Lifestyle: Healthy diet, regular exercise, blood sugar monitoring
//healthProblem 2: Hypertension (High Blood Pressure) Hypertension (High Blood Pressure) A condition in which the force of the blood against artery walls is consistently too high. 1. Headaches
2. Shortness of breath
3. Nosebleeds
4. Fatigue or confusion
5. Chest pain 1. Medications: ACE inhibitors, Beta-blockers, Diuretics
2. Lifestyle: Reduce salt intake, exercise regularly, manage stress
//healthProblem 3: Asthma Asthma A condition in which the airways narrow and swell, causing difficulty in breathing. 1. Shortness of breath
2. Wheezing or whistling sound when breathing
3. Chest tightness
4. Persistent coughing 1. Medications: Inhalers (e.g., Albuterol)
2. Lifestyle: Avoid allergens, quit smoking, use air purifiers
//healthProblem 4: Celiac Disease Celiac Disease An autoimmune disorder where consuming gluten damages the small intestine. 1. Diarrhea
2. Bloating
3. Weight loss
4. Fatigue
5. Abdominal pain
6. Nutrient deficiencies 1. Lifestyle: Strict gluten-free diet
2. Supplements: Iron, calcium, or other nutrients as needed
//healthProblem 5: Migraine Migraine A neurological condition that causes severe headaches and other symptoms. 1. Severe headache (often on one side)
2. Sensitivity to light and sound
3. Nausea or vomiting
4. Aura (flashing lights or blind spots) 1. Medications: Pain relievers (e.g., Ibuprofen), triptans (e.g., Sumatriptan)
2. Lifestyle: Avoid triggers, maintain consistent sleep and meal schedules
//healthProblem 6: Osteoporosis Osteoporosis A condition where bones become weak and brittle, increasing the risk of fractures. 1. Back pain
2. Loss of height over time
3. Stooped posture
4. Bones that break easily 1. Medications: Bisphosphonates (e.g., Alendronate)
2. Lifestyle: Calcium and vitamin D supplements, weight-bearing exercises
//healthProblem 7: Depression Depression A mood disorder causing persistent feelings of sadness and loss of interest. 1. Persistent sadness or emptiness
2. Loss of interest in activities
3. Changes in appetite or sleep patterns
4. Fatigue
5. Difficulty concentrating 1. Medications: Antidepressants (e.g., SSRIs like Sertraline)
2. Therapy: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT)
3. Lifestyle: Regular exercise, mindfulness, social support
//healthProblem 8: Anemia Anemia A condition where the body lacks enough healthy red blood cells to carry oxygen. 1. Fatigue
2. Weakness
3. Pale or yellowish skin
4. Shortness of breath
5. Dizziness 1. Medications: Iron supplements, vitamin B12 injections
2. Diet: Iron-rich foods (e.g., spinach, red meat)
//healthProblem 9: Tuberculosis (TB) Tuberculosis (TB) A contagious bacterial infection that primarily affects the lungs. 1. Persistent cough (lasting more than 3 weeks)
2. Coughing up blood
3. Chest pain
4. Fatigue
5. Fever and night sweats
6. Weight loss 1. Medications: Rifampin, Isoniazid, Ethambutol
2. Complete the full course of antibiotics
//healthProblem 10: Dengue Fever Dengue Fever A mosquito-borne viral infection causing flu-like symptoms. 1. High fever
2. Severe headache
3. Pain behind the eyes
4. Joint and muscle pain
5. Rash
6. Fatigue 1. No specific medicine; manage symptoms with rest, fluids, and pain relievers (e.g., Paracetamol)
//healthProblem 11: Malaria Malaria A mosquito-borne disease caused by Plasmodium parasites. 1. Fever and chills
2. Sweats
3. Headache
4. Nausea and vomiting
5. Muscle pain
6. Fatigue 1. Medications: Chloroquine, Artemisinin-based combination therapy (ACT)
//healthProblem 12: Obesity Obesity A condition characterized by excessive body fat, increasing the risk of various health problems. 1. High BMI (Body Mass Index)
2. Fatigue
3. Difficulty with physical activity
4. Increased risk of heart disease, diabetes, and joint pain 1. Lifestyle: Healthy diet, regular exercise
2. Medications: Weight-loss drugs (e.g., Orlistat)
3. Surgery: Bariatric surgery in severe cases
//healthProblem 13: Hepatitis B Hepatitis B A viral infection that attacks the liver and can cause acute and chronic diseases. 1. Yellowing of the skin (jaundice)
2. Dark urine
3. Fatigue
4. Abdominal pain
5. Nausea 1. Medications: Antiviral drugs (e.g., Tenofovir, Entecavir)
2. Prevention: Vaccination
//healthProblem 14: COVID-19 COVID-19 A respiratory illness caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus. 1. Fever
2. Cough
3. Shortness of breath
4. Loss of taste or smell
5. Fatigue 1. Medications: Antivirals (e.g., Remdesivir)
2. Prevention: Vaccination, mask-wearing, hand hygiene
//healthProblem 15: Alzheimer's Disease Alzheimer's Disease A progressive neurological disorder causing memory loss and cognitive decline. 1. Memory loss
2. Confusion
3. Difficulty completing familiar tasks
4. Mood changes
5. Difficulty speaking or writing 1. Medications: Donepezil, Memantine
2. Lifestyle: Cognitive therapy, supportive care
